meanings.sent1: When you peel off a sticker, it delaminates into two layers.
meanings.sent2: The old paint on the wall started to delaminate, revealing the layer underneath.
meanings.sent3: The cake delaminated as I tried to cut it, creating a messy but tasty result.
meanings.sent4: The ice on the pond delaminated with a loud crack, forming distinct layers.
meanings.sent5: The glue began to delaminate, causing the paper to come apart easily.

meanings.sent1: The strong wind can delaminate the paint on the house.
meanings.sent2: The heat from the sun delaminates the layers of the asphalt on the road.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally delaminated the sandwich while trying to cut it in half.
meanings.sent4: The chef's skillful knife work delaminated the vegetables beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The chemicals in the solution delaminate the mixture into distinct layers.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the plywood delaminates due to exposure to moisture.
meanings.sent2: The rock formations in the canyon naturally delaminate over centuries.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream began to delaminate in the cone, creating a delicious mess.
meanings.sent4: The old book's pages started to delaminate, revealing its age.
meanings.sent5: The paint on the car began to delaminate, showing the layers of previous colors.
